metadata.Title: CVE-2021-35942 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: The wordexp function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.33 may crash or read arbitrary memory in parse_param (in posix/wordexp.c) when called with an untrusted, crafted pattern, potentially resulting in a denial of service or disclosure of information. This occurs because atoi was used but strtoul should have been used to ensure correct calculations.

criterions.comment: glibc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
